trans-unit.source: To verify your connection using the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: To verify your connection using the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: You can verify a VPN connection in the Azure portal by navigating to **Virtual network gateways** **>** ***click your gateway name*** **>** **Settings** **>** **Connections**.
trans-unit.target: You can verify a VPN connection in the Azure portal by navigating to **Virtual network gateways** **>** ***click your gateway name*** **>** **Settings** **>** **Connections**.

trans-unit.source: By selecting the name of the connection, you can view more information about the connection.
trans-unit.target: By selecting the name of the connection, you can view more information about the connection.

trans-unit.source: In the example below, the connection is not connected and there is no data flowing through.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, the connection is not connected and there is no data flowing through.

trans-unit.source: To verify your connection using PowerShell
trans-unit.target: To verify your connection using PowerShell

trans-unit.source: It is also possible to verify that your connection succeeded by using `Get-AzureRmVirtualNetworkGatewayConnection –Debug`.
trans-unit.target: It is also possible to verify that your connection succeeded by using `Get-AzureRmVirtualNetworkGatewayConnection –Debug`.

trans-unit.source: You can use the following cmdlet example, configuring the values to match your own.
trans-unit.target: You can use the following cmdlet example, configuring the values to match your own.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, select *A* in order to run All.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, select *A* in order to run All.

trans-unit.source: After the cmdlet has finished, scroll through to view the values.
trans-unit.target: After the cmdlet has finished, scroll through to view the values.

trans-unit.source: In the example below, the connection status shows as *Connected* and you can see ingress and egress bytes.
trans-unit.target: In the example below, the connection status shows as *Connected* and you can see ingress and egress bytes.
